title: Zonguldrok's Shrine
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                            |
| - | ------------------------------------------ |
|   | No life grows here. It is completely dead. |

**Zonguldrok's Shrine** (also known as *Zonguldrok's Mausoleum*) is a [Wizard Laboratory](/Wizard_Laboratory "Wizard Laboratory") that serves as the final resting place for the great [necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer") Zonguldrok. It consists of an outer graveyard which slowly fills with powerful undead, as well as an inner chamber which houses Zonguldrok's remains and the guardians of the shrine.

Initially, the outer graveyard is empty except for a multitude of gravestones. These will be gradually replaced with monsters as you explore. The door leading to the inner chamber will only appear after enough of these monsters have been killed. Once inside, you'll be attacked by several more skeletal warriors, and beyond them, you'll find the grave of Zonguldrok.

|   |                                                                          |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A gravestone. The name "Zonguldrok" is engraved on it in golden letters. |

[![Zonguldrok's grave.png](/images/4/46/Zonguldrok%27s_grave.png)](/File:Zonguldrok%27s_grave.png) Past this gravestone you'll find a pair of treasure chambers, filled with an assortment of [potions](/Potion "Potion"), [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll"), and the evil [Sword of Zonguldrok](/Sword_of_Zonguldrok "Sword of Zonguldrok"), a powerful artefact [double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword") which raises the fallen to serve you.

## Contents

- [1 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [2 Antique Champions](#Antique_Champions)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Map](#Map)
- [5 History](#History)

## Monsters

- Z [![Large zombie.png](/images/d/d6/Large_zombie.png)](/File:Large_zombie.png) **[Zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")** - Slow melee attackers that will continually rise from the many gravestones in the graveyard. Eventually they will stop coming. [Ettin](/Ettin "Ettin") and [juggernaut](/Juggernaut "Juggernaut") zombies still hit hard, so be careful not to get swamped by them.
- W [![Phantasmal warrior.png](/images/7/71/Phantasmal_warrior.png)](/File:Phantasmal_warrior.png) **[Phantasmal warrior](/Phantasmal_warrior "Phantasmal warrior")** - Ghosts that will annoyingly [blink](/Blink "Blink") around you and halve your willpower on a successful hit. Beware of them in conjuction with vampires.
- V [![Vampire (monster).png](/images/d/df/Vampire_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Vampire_\(monster\).png) **[Vampire (monster)](/Vampire_\(monster\) "Vampire (monster)")** - These can be dangerous if you have low [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") or let them live long enough to go [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") and pester you while you deal with more pressing concerns. Rarely a major threat, however.
- V [![Vampire knight.png](/images/b/be/Vampire_knight.png)](/File:Vampire_knight.png) **[Vampire knight](/Vampire_knight "Vampire knight")** - Far more dangerous than normal vampires, these enemies can make themselves hasted and invisible while paralyzing and chopping you to pieces.
- V [![Jiangshi.png](/images/5/59/Jiangshi.png)](/File:Jiangshi.png) **[Jiangshi](/Jiangshi "Jiangshi")** - [Vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") zombies that move extremely quickly, but skip most turns.
- n [![Ghoul.png](/images/e/e3/Ghoul.png)](/File:Ghoul.png) **[Ghoul (monster)](/Ghoul_\(monster\) "Ghoul (monster)")** - Bulky, undead melee brutes. Hits harder than most of the other enemies here, but have no special abilities to speak of. There aren't really any chokepoints on the floor, however, so avoid getting surrounded.
- z [![Skeletal warrior.png](/images/2/2f/Skeletal_warrior.png)](/File:Skeletal_warrior.png) **[Skeletal warrior](/Skeletal_warrior "Skeletal warrior")** - These melee fighters are stronger than the zombies or vampires, but you should be able to handle them easily enough if you've survived to this point.
- z [![Ancient champion.png](/images/8/81/Ancient_champion.png)](/File:Ancient_champion.png) **[Ancient champion](/Ancient_champion "Ancient champion")** - These are much more dangerous than skeletal warriors. They are capable of hasting themselves and blasting you with [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot").
- z [![Antique champion.png](/images/d/d7/Antique_champion.png)](/File:Antique_champion.png) **Antique champion** - Two of these will spawn in the central chamber, guarding the loot (see below).

## Antique Champions

| antique champion z [![Antique champion.png](/images/d/d7/Antique_champion.png)](/File:Antique_champion.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                             |

| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                                            | [Undead](/Category:Undead_holiness "Category:Undead holiness")                                                                                                                              |

| [Type](/Type "Type")                                                                                        | ancient champion, ancient champion                                                                                                                                                          |
| Flags                                                                                                       | [Fighter](/Fighter_flag "Fighter flag") [Evil](/Evil "Evil") [See invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible") [Unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing")                                      |

|   |                                                                                                                          |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | An unfathomably expensive skeleton. It has countless sigils engraved into its bones, and pulses with a ghostly presence. |

These opponents are capable of dealing obscene damage, especially to the living or poorly armored, and should be prepared for accordingly.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                 |                                                     |
| :---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Ghostly Fireball](/Ghostly_Fireball "Ghostly Fireball") (3d24) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt")                                         | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Might](/Might "Might")                                         | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Haste](/Haste "Haste")                                         | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## History

- Zonguldrok's Shrine was buffed again in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), replacing the single **Antique Lich** ([ancient lich](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich")) with two Antique Champions, heavily buffing the undead spawns as well as gaining a greater focus on martial items.
- Zonguldrok's Shrine received a buff in 0.14, with an upgraded monster set and shorter spawning intervals.
html:
Zonguldrok's Shrine

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
No life grows here. It is completely dead.

Zonguldrok's Shrine (also known as Zonguldrok's Mausoleum) is a Wizard Laboratory that serves as the final resting place for the great necromancer Zonguldrok. It consists of an outer graveyard which slowly fills with powerful undead, as well as an inner chamber which houses Zonguldrok's remains and the guardians of the shrine.

Initially, the outer graveyard is empty except for a multitude of gravestones. These will be gradually replaced with monsters as you explore. The door leading to the inner chamber will only appear after enough of these monsters have been killed. Once inside, you'll be attacked by several more skeletal warriors, and beyond them, you'll find the grave of Zonguldrok.

A gravestone. The name "Zonguldrok" is engraved on it in golden letters.

Past this gravestone you'll find a pair of treasure chambers, filled with an assortment of potions, scrolls, and the evil Sword of Zonguldrok, a powerful artefact double sword which raises the fallen to serve you.

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Antique Champions
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Map
  • 5 History

Monsters

  • Z Zombie - Slow melee attackers that will continually rise from the many gravestones in the graveyard. Eventually they will stop coming. Ettin and juggernaut zombies still hit hard, so be careful not to get swamped by them.
  • W Phantasmal warrior - Ghosts that will annoyingly blink around you and halve your willpower on a successful hit. Beware of them in conjuction with vampires.
  • V Vampire (monster) - These can be dangerous if you have low willpower or let them live long enough to go invisible and pester you while you deal with more pressing concerns. Rarely a major threat, however.
  • V Vampire knight - Far more dangerous than normal vampires, these enemies can make themselves hasted and invisible while paralyzing and chopping you to pieces.
  • V Jiangshi - Vampiric zombies that move extremely quickly, but skip most turns.
  • n Ghoul (monster) - Bulky, undead melee brutes. Hits harder than most of the other enemies here, but have no special abilities to speak of. There aren't really any chokepoints on the floor, however, so avoid getting surrounded.
  • z Skeletal warrior - These melee fighters are stronger than the zombies or vampires, but you should be able to handle them easily enough if you've survived to this point.
  • z Ancient champion - These are much more dangerous than skeletal warriors. They are capable of hasting themselves and blasting you with Iron Shot.
  • z Antique champion - Two of these will spawn in the central chamber, guarding the loot (see below).

Antique Champions

antique champion z 
HP 64-131
HD 20
XP 3017
Speed 10
AC 20
EV 15
Will 120
Attack1 35 (hit: plain)


Resistances rC+
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type ancient champion, ancient champion
Flags Fighter
Evil
See invisible
Unbreathing
An unfathomably expensive skeleton. It has countless sigils engraved into its bones, and pulses with a ghostly presence.

These opponents are capable of dealing obscene damage, especially to the living or poorly armored, and should be prepared for accordingly.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Ghostly Fireball (3d24) Wizard flag
Slot2 Haunt Wizard flag
Slot3 Might Wizard flag
Slot4 Haste Wizard flag

Map

   xx?????????????????xx
    xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
ENDMAP

History

  • Zonguldrok's Shrine was buffed again in 0.31, replacing the single Antique Lich (ancient lich) with two Antique Champions, heavily buffing the undead spawns as well as gaining a greater focus on martial items.
  • Zonguldrok's Shrine received a buff in 0.14, with an upgraded monster set and shorter spawning intervals.

{{version031}} {{flavour|No life grows here. It is completely dead.}} '''Zonguldrok's Shrine''' (also known as ''Zonguldrok's Mausoleum'') is a [[Wizard Laboratory]] that serves as the final resting place for the great [[necromancer]] Zonguldrok. It consists of an outer graveyard which slowly fills with powerful undead, as well as an inner chamber which houses Zonguldrok's remains and the guardians of the shrine. Initially, the outer graveyard is empty except for a multitude of gravestones. These will be gradually replaced with monsters as you explore. The door leading to the inner chamber will only appear after enough of these monsters have been killed. Once inside, you'll be attacked by several more skeletal warriors, and beyond them, you'll find the grave of Zonguldrok. {{flavour|A gravestone. The name "Zonguldrok" is engraved on it in golden letters.}} [[File:Zonguldrok's grave.png]] Past this gravestone you'll find a pair of treasure chambers, filled with an assortment of [[potion]]s, [[scroll]]s, and the evil [[Sword of Zonguldrok]], a powerful artefact [[double sword]] which raises the fallen to serve you. ==Monsters== *{{Brown|Z}} [[File:Large_zombie.png]] '''[[Zombie]]''' - Slow melee attackers that will continually rise from the many gravestones in the graveyard. Eventually they will stop coming. [[Ettin]] and [[juggernaut]] zombies still hit hard, so be careful not to get swamped by them. *{{monsterlink|Phantasmal warrior}} - Ghosts that will annoyingly [[blink]] around you and halve your willpower on a successful hit. Beware of them in conjuction with vampires. *{{monsterlink|Vampire (monster)}} - These can be dangerous if you have low [[willpower]] or let them live long enough to go [[invisible]] and pester you while you deal with more pressing concerns. Rarely a major threat, however. *{{monsterlink|Vampire knight}} - Far more dangerous than normal vampires, these enemies can make themselves hasted and invisible while paralyzing and chopping you to pieces. *{{monsterlink|Jiangshi}} - [[Vampiric]] zombies that move extremely quickly, but skip most turns. *{{monsterlink|Ghoul (monster)}} - Bulky, undead melee brutes. Hits harder than most of the other enemies here, but have no special abilities to speak of. There aren't really any chokepoints on the floor, however, so avoid getting surrounded. *{{monsterlink|Skeletal warrior}} - These melee fighters are stronger than the zombies or vampires, but you should be able to handle them easily enough if you've survived to this point. *{{monsterlink|Ancient champion}} - These are much more dangerous than skeletal warriors. They are capable of hasting themselves and blasting you with [[Iron Shot]]. *{{Blue|z}} [[File:Antique champion.png]] '''Antique champion''' - Two of these will spawn in the central chamber, guarding the loot (see below). ==Antique Champions== {{monster info|antique champion}} These opponents are capable of dealing obscene damage, especially to the living or poorly armored, and should be prepared for accordingly. {{monster spells|antique champion}} ==Map==
